roleset.name: have affection towards, be fond of, enjoy (habitually)
roleset.note: LIKE-V NOTES: PReditor picks up prepositional usages of "like" (meaning "such as"and tagged as adjective) which should be ignored. Even worse,"unlike" is picked up and included in the .arch files, so you'll seesome sentences which at first glance seem to have no "like" predicatesat all. (from like.01-v)
LIKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, like-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls admire-31.2-1, want-32.1-1-1. (from liking.01-n)

example.name: like-v: semi-modal
example.text: I'd like a flight on American from Newark to Nashville.
example.arg: a flight on American from Newark to Nashville

example.name: like-v: prefer
example.text: John likes dill pickles on his grilled cheese sandwiches.
example.arg: dill pickles on his grilled cheese sandwiches

example.name: liking-n: just arg0
example.text: It 's the only team that has the capacity to send me into the depths of despair -LRB- all too often for my liking -RRB- , or run around screaming and shouting with joy .

example.name: liking-n: True story. Both args
example.text: 30% of my liking the decemberists is their obsession with boats

roleset.name: would like, wish, want (polite)
roleset.note: LIKE-V NOTES: This proves that "like" cannot be treated as a modal, because Englishdoesn't otherwise allow two modal verbs in a single sentences (withthe exception of certain dialects, notably Southern, which might couldsay such things). (from like.02-v)
LIKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on like.02. No VNcls. (from liking.02-n)

example.name: like-v: modal
example.text: I would like *trace* to find a flight that goes from Boston to Orlando.
example.arg: *trace* to find a flight that goes from Boston to Orlando

example.name: liking-n: Harsh. both args
example.text: The Emperor has demonstrated his liking to inflict pain on people just as people born under the sign Aries often do.
example.arg: just as people born under the sign Aries often do

roleset.name: similar
roleset.note: LIKE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from like.01-j)

example.name: like-j: both args
example.text: He had a colonoscopy performed today with a decent amount of stool that did note an hepatic flexure mass , which-1 [*-1] was flat and broad and plaque - like .

roleset.name: draw a similarity
roleset.note: LIKEN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'liken' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from liken.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: liken-v: all args
example.text: Raymond Chandler, in a 1950 letter defending a weak Hemingway book, likened a champion writer to a baseball pitcher.
example.arg: in a 1950 letter defending a weak Hemingway book

roleset.name: similar
roleset.note: ALIKE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. Relation to 'liken' (from alike.01-j)

example.name: alike-j: arg1
example.text: Yea . She 's my godmom . We 're extremely alike it 's scary .

example.name: alike-j: both args
example.text: They were alike in their ability to read a person's true motives
example.arg: in their ability to read a person's true motives

example.name: liking-j: concatenation
example.text: Both of these ills are far more widespread and important than the threat of terrorism , as of which we are more liking to die by our own hands rather than by the hand of an ' Islamic terrorist ' .
example.arg: [we] [to die by our own hands rather than by the hand of an ' Islamic terrorist ' ]
